text: Philip Short (born on 17 April 1945) is an English journalist. He studied at Queens' College, Cambridge between 1963 and 1966. After his graduation, he spent from 1967 to 1973 as a freelance journalist, first in Malawi, then in Uganda. He then joined the BBC (British Broadcasting Corporation) as a foreign correspondent in Moscow and other places. He is an author of many books, such as biographies of Mao Zedong, Mao: A Life, and of Pol Pot, Pol Pot: Anatomy of a Nightmare. He now lives in France.
